intro: Parosela arsenei, commonly known as the Armenian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Parosela arsenei is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often found in alpine meadows.
